dct_title_s: [World, gnomonic proj. I. Africa and south Europe]
dct_description_sm: Key at bottom left (beneath map): Italic figures along the coast shew the time of High Water in the time at the Place ; Roman ... in Greenwich time ; Pecked lines are the cotidal lines, or th eseries of points on the surface of the ocean where high water takes place at the same instant.
Shows topography, drainage, ports, islands surrounding continent, political boundaries.
Includes eastern edge of Brazilian coast.
Appears in Atlas for the Society for the Diffusion of Useful Knowledge, London: Chas. Knight & Co., 1846, 1849, 1852.
